channel.title: Comments on: Continuous Delivery with TeamCity
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Keith
item.dc:creator: Keith
item.description: Great tutorial, it's amazing how many ways there are to do this, nice to see a complex build made simple.
item.content:encoded: Great tutorial, it’s amazing how many ways there are to do this, nice to see a complex build made simple.

item.title: By: Jason
item.dc:creator: Jason
item.description: excellent use cases, I am trolling your site as I engage in similar projects with TC. Thank you!
item.content:encoded: excellent use cases, I am trolling your site as I engage in similar projects with TC. Thank you!

item.title: By: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.dc:creator: Eli Weinstock-Herman (tarwn)
item.content:encoded:
@Shawn: Absolutely. Sorry for the delay, I was out of town for a bit. I assume the step you need is probably #2:

“C:Program FilesIISMicrosoft Web Deploy V2msdeploy.exe” -source:package=’%system.teamcity.build.workingDir%PriorArtifactsMvcMusicStore.zip’ -dest:auto,computerName=’%COMPUTER%’,userName=’%USERNAME%’,password=’%PASSWORD%’,includeAcls=’False’ -verb:sync -disableLink:AppPoolExtension -disableLink:ContentExtension -disableLink:CertificateExtension -setParamFile=”%system.teamcity.build.workingDir%PriorArtifactsMvcMusicStore.InterfaceTest.xml”

you can see the configuration parameter values above in the post (they are based on the ones in bt2 which is the CI build). The MvcMusicStore.InterfaceTest.xml is available at bitbucket and is the parameters (including IIS application name) that will be substituted into the web.config during deployment.

If you are running into some specific errors, post them in the forum and I’ll see if I can help out more.

item.title: By: Shawn
item.dc:creator: Shawn
item.description: Enjoyed following along with your Jenkins series. As I am trying out TeamCity for the first time, could you possibly provide the actual text that goes along with http://tiernok.com/LTDBlog/ContinuousDelivery/TeamCity_09.png. I have been unable to recreate all 5 steps. Is there a way to export it so someone else could import it?<br /> <br />
item.content:encoded: Enjoyed following along with your Jenkins series. As I am trying out TeamCity for the first time, could you possibly provide the actual text that goes along with http://tiernok.com/LTDBlog/ContinuousDelivery/TeamCity_09.png. I have been unable to recreate all 5 steps. Is there a way to export it so someone else could import it?
